summary: A letter from law professor Paul G. Cassell to Assistant U.S. Attorney Vernon Miles regarding an investigation into Bruce Reinhart. Cassell alleges that Reinhart, a former federal prosecutor, made a false sworn declaration about his knowledge of the Epstein investigation and later represented Epstein associates while working in an office adjacent to Epstein's company. Cassell writes on behalf of two Jane Doe victims.

keyFacts: Bruce Reinhart, a former federal prosecutor on the Epstein case, later represented multiple Epstein employees (including Ghislaine Maxwell) in civil suits while his private office was located next to an Epstein-owned company.
Reinhart made a sworn declaration stating he never learned confidential information about the Epstein matter, which the U.S. Attorney's Office has since admitted is false.
Paul Cassell alleges Reinhart's actions contravene Justice Department regulations and Florida bar rules and create an appearance of currying favor with Epstein.
The letter frames Jane Doe No. 1 and Jane Doe No. 2 as 'victims' of Reinhart's alleged federal crime of perjury due to his false statement.
The document highlights the close physical and professional proximity between Epstein's defense team and a former prosecutor who had worked on his case.
